column4: I want to print two pages on a single page from Firefox. How do I do that? I could do it in windows but the printer options aren't the same...
can anyone help?
try lpoptions -o page-set=odd and then when you have printed that page...
type lpoptions -r page-set and then lpoptions page-set=even
and reprint the page. when all is done remove the option with lpoptions -r page-set
would that not be for printing back and front? i can do that. its to have two pages, shrunk on the same side...
Oh sorry mate, yeah.. bear with me
You have the cups server installed on the same machine right?
try this url --> http://127.0.0.1:631/help/options.html?QUERY=n%20up#NUMBERUP
err. im a little new to all this. i only have the one computer...
no worries, try the url I just pasted
ok that seems to be what im looking for thanks. now ill have to figure out how to print from command line...
i dont suppose there'd be a way to incorporate these options into the dialog box that appears when i click print?
all you need to do is open a terminal up and replace lpr with lpoptions
eg:lp -o number-up=2 filename will become lpoptions -o number-up=2 filename
then print your page through firefox as normal
ah i see. ok. thanks.
then when finished type lpoptions -r number-up so you don't do all your printing like that!
